headline: The Best Meatloaf
description: This juicy meatloaf with green peppers and onion is topped with steak sauce for a surefire hit any night of the week.

video.description: This meatloaf is hearty and easy to assemble, a great weeknight meal.
video.name: The Best Meatloaf

name: The Best Meatloaf
recipeIngredient: 0.25 cup steak sauce, or more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease an 8x4-inch loaf pan. Combine bread crumbs and milk in a small bowl; set aside to soften.
Mix ground beef, onion, bell pepper, steak sauce, egg, salt, and black pepper in a large bowl; add bread crumb mixture and mix with your hands until combined.
Pat the mixture into the prepared loaf pan; brush the top with 1/4 cup steak sauce.

Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the center, about 1 hour. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C). Allow to stand for 5 minutes before slicing.

review.reviewBody: Love this recipe. Easy and great flavor. My whole family enjoys it and they are super picky. Will definitely make again.
Awesome!
Great flavors. I had dinner with this and had two days of meatloaf sandwiches for lunch.
I have been using THIS recipe for years already! Perfect every time I knew it would become a regular entree in our house because my picky kid loved it!
Best meatloaf recipe ever! I use Heinz 57 and A1 steak sauce in this. I have one slice and my son finishes the loaf!
We loved this with one change is all. I used BBQ sauce instead of steak sauce since it was what we had in the fridge. Sooooo delish and we will def be making it again.
To make this keto friendly substitute heavy cream for milk and pork panko for bread crumbs. Still comes out really good. Great recipe.
The flavor was good but the texture was very odd and unpleasant. I’m not sure why…

Very simple recipe that my 12 year old wanted to surprise his mother with for dinner. He made it all by himself and turned out great
Oh my goodness! I made this a few months ago and today my husband asked for it! He has never been a meatloaf eater, EVER!
My family loved this meatloaf recipe. Unfortunately, it was gone before I had the chance to take a picture. I’ll make it again next week and take the picture then.
I made it exactly to the recipe and it was really good. My wife liked it, only the second meatloaf she has ever liked. I think I am going to add some fresh herbs next time.
DELICIOUS. I am very picky about my meatloaf. This recipe is easy and moist. I always add Knorr's onion soup mix instead of salt and pepper. Love the steak sauce too.
Love it but if making with 2 lbs needs to add 20-30 minutes to completely cook
Made it last night, was great but a tad salty. I'm going to cut back on salt next time

Used this recipe to make meatloaf tonight. It came out great! The recipe is so easy to follow and not many ingredients are needed, anyone can make this! Hubby loved it so that’s the most important part!!
I like this recipe but one onion is a bit much. It was a bit overpowering. Otherwise, it was a great recipe. I ended up glazing the top with bbq sauce the last 20 minutes.
Spot on. Fantastic recipe! No changes needed.
Great and easy recipe. I used Italian bread crumbs? and it worked fine. I also added ricotta cheese that I had left over from another recipe and I gave gave it a nice flavor.
I made this recipe recently but it didn't turn out as good as I expected. Don't know why but I will make it once more to see if it turns out differently.
Awesome recipe! I mixed 1/3 cup of bbq sauce (Heinz 57) in to 2 pounds of meat and used 1 cup of plain breadcrumbs, which didn’t need to be soaked first.
Really moist and almost sweet. We loved it!
Worcestershire Sauce works great.

mm-mm-mm. ooh my this was good. I kept to the recipe except I added an egg, used Sweet Baby Ray's sweet and spicy sauce, and instead of adding peppers to the mix I air fried a bag of sweet mini peppers and baby carrots to go with the main course.

I make some similar changes. I’ve used this as my base meatloaf for years now. I have had to soak a piece of toasted bread in the milk once because I didn’t have stuffing mix or bread crumbs. I prefer a ketchup and balsamic vinegarette mixture as my “sauce” a little on top and in the meat mixture. I do add onions (never bell pepper), dry sage & parsley, garlic powder (or minced garlic), onion powder, a dash of Worcestershire, a 1/3 cube of beef bullion or a tap of beef bullion powder and salt & pepper. The balsamic/ketchup mixture is always a hit for us. I have never been asked for a recipe more. Also, I periodically drain the hot fat out of my pan while cooking. It tends to cook faster and not be as moist.
This was my first time cooking meatloaf. I love this recipe. It’s so easy and quite tasty.
Sorry but this did nothing for me. There are so many other meatloaves out there. Not sure what everyone else saw in this but it is not “the best” for us.
It turned out perfect! I prepped it in the morning so it had a chance to sit in the fridge all day and marinate in the sauce. Baked up perfectly. It was a hit. Will definitely make again.
I make these in muffin tins for a 20 min bake time. if there are any left overs, 1 "muffin" makes 1 sandwich!

I went later on the steak sauce as I believe a real meatloaf needs to have its Worcestershire mustard and ketchup in it! My kids don’t like diced peppers and onions chunks so I grate them with a cheese grater and they have no idea that they’re in there. My husband could eat this every day we want to serve it with mashed potatoes and corn.
Best meatloaf ever!
Excellent. Very moist.
very good use a larger baking dish
This is so much better than using the ketchup. Best meatloaf I’ve had. Thanks. ????
Hands down one of the best meatloafs I’ve had! I highly recommend it! I didn’t change anything done it as is. I was a little skeptical about it but I gave it a chance and was NOT disappointed!

Flavorless hunk of meat. Everytime I see a bad review on a 5-star something, I think, "man that person really screwed up." kinda hard to screw up mix everything in a bowl and put it in the oven -- worst meatloaf I've ever had.

I guess I'm that person this time.
This was very good, my husband liked it very much. I find there was too much milk and was a bit loose. Maybe it was my bread? I will make again and decrease liquids. Good recipe!
No steak sauce, but bbq and Texas Pete was a tasty substitute! Used 1/2 ketchup and 1/2 bbq sauce for the glaze. Came out great!

Omgggg this was so delicious!!!! It was moist and cooked to perfection. I tweaked it a bit based on past reviews and even still my husband was impressed. Instead of regular bread I used stove top turkey stuffing and instead of steak sauce I used Diana’s BBQ sauce. I also used minced veal instead of beef!

My son had friends over yesterday and i doubled the recipe for 6 big appetites. We, however, shaped them and cooked on wire rack to lose the drippings. Also, added garlic powder because we put it on everything! Thanks for the share!
My husband loved it!
Just made it. It was excellent.

I made it exactly as was described. I tripled everything and made three loads at a time as I cook for 20 people on the weekends. Everyone loved it and came back for seconds. It’s just the most exquisite dish
Very good although I would add something a little spicy. I thought it was slightly bland.
Way Too much onion!!!!
Tasted good enough, but it came out of the oven floating in an inch of greasy liquid. I'll try it with leaner meat next time and see if that fixes it.
This will be my go to for meat loaf!!!!

Though I am sure the original recipe is delicious, I found substitutions I made because some ingredients were missing made the most amazing meatloaf. I had 3# of burger to make before it's best by date so I doubled the recipe. I was out of onion but had shallots so substituted 2 large shallots instead of 2 onions. I was out of milk but had sour cream so I subbed that for the milk & un-toasted sourdough bread for the soft breadcrumbs. Finally I didn't have steak sauce but did have a can of HUNTS seasoned sauce for meatloaf in it's place. everything else was followed and This is the best meatloaf I have ever had! Thank for sharing!!
Love this recipe I make it often it’s delicious!!!
This is delicious!! Made it exactly as stated except used Sweet Baby Rays over the top instead of more A1. This is a keeper!
This was super easy to make. It was a hit with my family! Turned out very moist and flavorful!
This was so tasty and moist! Perfect amount too for my husband and I and still had left overs. I added minced garlic as I love this flavor and it tasted great.
Was looking for a go-to meatloaf recipe. This is excellent! I loved it and my wife did as well.

I used Two lbs. of hamburger meat and a whole green pepper and worshistershire sauce and A1 and two onions Because I used Two lbs of hamburger I used Two eggs. It turned out Really Good and we had plenty left over for Sandwiches
I am dairy free so I used almond breeze for milk and 1/2 cup of oatmeal for three bread. Turned out juicy and delicious.
This is a great ! I personally used Panko instead of regular breadcrumbs. I also suggest using extra Heinz !!
Recommend half the amount of onion. Wayyy too much with a whole onion.
All I can say was it was food. The worst meatloaf I ever made. My "throw it together's" turn out tastier than this one.
I love this recipe. I used red & green bell peppers along with all the other ingredients. The steak sauce really enhances the flavors.
Very good. I added minced garlic, oregano, and more salt and pepper

This was the best meatloaf I have ever made!! It was so moist and flavorful! I used Butter crackers crumbled instead of bread, and half A1, half au jus. It was amazing, will definitely be making this again!!!
Great!

I have made many meatloaf recipes over the years, as have several family members in my family. However this is by far the best meatloaf we have ever had, hands down! I made this exactly as the recipe states and I would not change a thing! Thanks for supplying our future favorite meatloaf!

Great recipe. I made it with 1 lb each of hamburger and Italian sausage, Italian bread crumbs instead of regular bread crumbs, exchange milk for prepared spaghetti sauce, and added beef bouillon paste to the egg. Tasted like a meatball in a loaf. The kids loved it.

This is a slam-dunk winner for meatloaf.... and like one of the others that lived it did, I cut it into generous slices and froze it - it handled that very well...... lovely, moist and tasty. Many thanks for sharing your family favourite recipe!!...

I have tried brushing the top of the meatloaf with a little bit extra steak sauce, but just very lightly brushed. It really is a great recipe and super delicious. It's super easy to make. The prep time doesn't take long either.

Made this for my roommate and myself. It was amazing! I added mushrooms and substituted the salt and pepper for tony chachere’s seasoning, garlic powder, and red pepper flakes. I also used manwich sauce instead of steak sauce. Delicious.
I doubled the recipe because I feed a family of 8. Very tasty very moist. Family loved it. Very easy to make. Will be making again.
I loved this recipe. I wouldn’t change a thing about it. Quick and easy
My sons favorite dish! I use Peter Lugers steak sauce. And I LOVE the nutritional breakdown in this app.
My was very moist, maybe a little too moist. But very simple and delicious.
I substituted red pepper for the green one. My family liked it better than any others that I have made. I will certainly make this again.
This is my family’s favorite meatloaf ever. Thank you for the recipe.

I found this recipe to be a top choice in our home. A favorite Go-To. 
Sorry to cherry pick your recipe but I did make a few alterations. 
First my kids don't care for crunchy vegs so i sauteed them on low heat w butter and olive oil(salt, pepper, Italian seasoning, garlic and onion powders) to soften them before adding to the mix.
Second, I leave out all other seasoning and add one pack of McCormick Meatloaf Seasoning.
Third and finally, I make this in the morning and put it, covered, in the fridge. I take it out 1 hour before placing in the oven. Putting it in the fridge seem to allow all the flavors to mead.
The added A-1 steak sauce on top is a crowd pleaser and a must! Don't overcook! Thank you

I've made this meatloaf twice within a week. Omitted the green pepper but otherwisd, followed it to a T. Used A-1 steak sauce. This is my new go to meatloaf recipe. Easy, moist, and great for sandwiches as leftovers.
Taste amazing very moist and simple directions to follow best meatloaf I ever tasted!

I'm a single dad who has never made meat loaf before. My son was craving it so I looked up and made it. The receipe was AWESOME. I love it and my son loved it even more! It was the best meatloaf I have ever had. Easy to make and tasted great. I added some ginger and Worcestershire Sauce to the mix that the receipe didn't call for, also a bit more milk and barbecue sauce.

My husband liked it, but I didn't. I made this exactly like the directions with no substitutions. the consistency was great. It was very moist. The flavor was very bland. I ended up having to put some onion soup seasoning in ketchup to dip it in while I ate it. If I made it again. I would add a packet of onion soup, and about a 1/4 cup of ketchup to the mixture before cooking. I think it would be perfect then.
Next time will leave out the 57 sauce (hubby isn't a fan and I didn't think he would notice lol). it's a winner for sure!

Turned out Fantastic . Did not have butter Crackers so I used Ritz. 
Will definitely make this recipe again.
Little to most for me. But it was Great.
I fixed it just like the recipe. It’s mild in flavor. The children really liked it. Leftovers Made a good meatloaf sandwich the following day. We will fix it again
Tasted very good! I used less onions. A definite keeper!

My husband doesn't usually care much for meatloaf but he loved this one and requested it again another time. Today, when I answered "Meatloaf" when he wanted to know what dinner was, he smiled and wanted to know when it would be ready.

Today, it was even a little bit better when I added 1 TBSP of Italian seasoning and 1 TBSP of minced garlic. I will keep making this recipe with whatever variations of ingredients I feel like adding. Experiment with it and make it your own.

We really enjoy this recipe. (Even with alterations.)

I changed the servings to 8 and made 2 one pound loaves. I’ve been having issues with getting meatloafs cooked through. This helped greatly. The one change I made is only in wording. I used chopped onions and peppers. I should have diced them. Besides that; great recipe and I’ll do it again with the diced veggies (which I thought was odd but wanted to rate the true recipe).

I made this tonight and it's delicious! the only adjustment I'd make is to sauteed the onions and pepper first. otherwise you end up biting into a big chunk of raw onion and pepper and it's a little unappetizing. but otherwise it's really good and was done pretty fast.
Steak sauce taste overwhelmed this meatloaf. I will stick to Manwich Meatloaf recipe.
Good basic meatloaf recipe, I didn't use green pepper. I used Heinz 57 steak sauce and really couldn't taste it-might have to try A-1. I also used 3/4 cup quick cook oats as filler instead of bread.

This was a delicious meatloaf! I was low on A1, so I also used Heinz 57. Also added diced jalapeños and mushrooms since we are all big fans of heat in this house. I doubled it and made 2 loaves, so total cook time was about 1 hour and 20 minutes.
No
My husband is a picky eater and he approved. I thought it was average.
It was my first loaf and it turned out amazing!

I've made this recipe 3 times in the past month. My only edit was that I cook the onions and peppers before adding them into the mix. If I don't have a bell pepper in the house, I substitute sweet peppers as I always have them. It turns out moist and delicious every time. The cook time is perfect for those of us at sea level. Leftovers are always just as yummy. My husband threw out his old recipe since he can't beat this one for taste and texture. It's a keeper.
No changes and I will make it again.
There are a few things I would change about this meatloaf. I love onion but one full onion is too much. Bell peppers give it a funky flavor. I changed to celery for a surprise crunch.

The Meatloaf was tasty and juicy. I added approx 1/4 cup shredded sharp cheddar cheese and a packet of sazon. I will use half an onion opposed to a whole onion next time. I just don’t like a strong onion taste.
